website_summaries.verdict: Precision-balanced product to ensure smooth operation with no pedal pulsation.
pros: OEM-style vane configuration for efficient heat dissipation
Reduces vibration and noise while extending rotor life
Offers consistent wear, long life, and quiet operation
Made of bi-metal aluminum and zinc
OEM-style ABS tone ring provides trouble-free operation
cons: Does not work with all the cars advertised

customer_reviews.title: Finally brakes that don’t warp and shake
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of issues with my brakes warping. I have purchased expensive kits from Amazon as well as rotors at the local auto store. These brake rotors finally did the trick for my Expedition. I was very skeptical because they are made in China but they work very well I have had them on my vehicle for over six months and a lot of driving conditions and there is no warping or no noise at all. I highly recommend these rotors
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramacciotti

customer_reviews.title: They're rotors!
customer_reviews.text: ***Another Update*** These are UNSAFE, DEPLORABLE. I am shocked that the D.O.T. allows such low grade garbage to be sold to consumers. ***UPDATE*** Not even a year later, these bad boys are WARPED. Lug nuts were torqued to spec. Issue came up after some heavy braking on the grapevine in So. Cal and only got worse from there out. I Read up further to figure out why they did that - Cheap alloy used as opposed to what the dealer uses. I am no metal specialist but when something poops out that fast, that says something about the quality..... I tried to like them! Round, Shiny and smooth...
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Lexus LS460L
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Wagner ThermoQuiet QC1282 Ceramic Disc Pad Set With Installation Hardware, Front and the Bosch 50011493 QuietCast Premium Disc Brake Rotor, Front for my 2010 Lexus LS460L. Pros: very quiet, smooth, zero brake dust, zero vibration. Even under heavy braking, they continue to have great performance. Can’t beat the price too. Con: The OEM metallic pads have more initial grip. They have more bite, just in the beginning. I would be willing to bet these add a few feet to the 60-0 braking distance vs OEM Lexus Pads. The conclusion is clear. I would buy this combo over and over again. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great Rotors for a great price!! 2010 Corolla
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some reliable rotors that were not crazy expensive. After some research, I found these Bosch rotors, and I really wanted rotors that did not rust so quickly. I installed these pretty quick with some new pads from ACDelco and I am extremely happy with these. Normally I would buy EBC brake parts but those were just too much money today. These rotors are great. They will make some noise for the first 10-20 miles because the coating needs to be removed from the rotors with the brake pads pressing against the rotors. Will update if any issues arise in the future. Worth the money. 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan T.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with rotor warpage after less than 4K miles as well. I drive down a hill on the way to work and braking over 45 MPH heats up brakes after the first 10 minutes of downhill driving. These are not good for driving conditions where consistent braking is needed like in the mountains. The steering column shakes and makes a super loud noise on that rotor. Uneven wear can be seen on the brake pads. Do not recommend and would return if it was still within return period.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Rotors were larger than originals, could not install
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product out of the box, very solid fabrication. But the diameter of the Bocsh was larger than the originals. You can see in the pic's - the Bosch is bigger. I could not mount the caliper brackets. I had to buy another pair locally and they fit perfectly. Amazon had verified these were a fit for Front rotors for a 2011 Honda Civic EX - Amazon is normally spot on, but didn't work this time.
customer_reviews.author: The Grander Son

customer_reviews.title: Nice rotors. No retaining screws.
customer_reviews.text: Works great paired up with Bosch brake pads. Important: your factory-installed rotors use two retaining screws (somewhat unusual.) You will have a hard time trying to unscrew them as they will more than likely be seized. You might end up drilling them out. The retaining screws don't really serve any purpose besides providing installation convenience, as far I can tell, so you simply forgo them. But if you insist on having them you should probably order a set as the new rotors don't come with new screws.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: 2016 Mini Cooper S JCW
customer_reviews.text: I received my product, everything looked correct, but as soon as I removed my original rotors & compared side by side, it was obvious that it was not the same and would not fit. The hub centric is much smaller on these Bosch rotors than my OEM. Very disappointed, the vehicle match also said it was correct for my vehicle. I will be returning for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Lé Coco

customer_reviews.title: Extremely smooth and quiet, with good stopping power
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2013 Toyota Highlander, replacing high-end slotted and drilled rotors that were warped. These rotors were paired with the matching Bosch ceramic brake pads. The rotors have been extremely smooth and quiet, with good stopping power. WARNING: Unlike many rotor products, these are NOT sold in pairs, but sold individually - you need to purchase two (2)! The matching brake pads ARE sold in pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit my vehicle even tho Amazon said that it would
customer_reviews.text: I am experiencing more and more problems with Amazon. I thought that I could rely on their selection of products and vendors for quality and value. I have recently purchased items that I had to return because they did not fit or were broken. This is what I expect from Ebay but not Amazon. I purchased this rotor based on Amazon stating that it would fit my vehicle. It was too big in diameter. I returned it. Last that I looked, noone has changed anything on that item that would inform people that it does not fit my particular vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great rotors, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my Mazda 3 and they work great so far. They are progressive with good feel, but not too much bite, but still plenty of stopping power. Very smooth and quiet too. Though to be fair, the old pads and rotors were completely shot, so just about anything would have been an improvement. They were easy to install once I got the old rotors off. The old ones were a major PIA to remove. Tried heat, penetrating oil, pry bars. I finally just beat them like a harp seal. Once the old ones were off, the new ones went on easy and fit just like OEM parts.
customer_reviews.author: Phil L.

customer_reviews.title: Quality, but prepare for a challenge!
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind you’ll need your rotors turned or you’ll need new quality replacements...that still might need turning it’s usually cheaper just to replace the rotors, which is sad. Anyhow, replace or turn rotors with new pads. You’ll likely encounter greatest trouble getting your old rotors off the hub. Start the day before with soaking the bolts or screws down there. Unless you are blessed with a (clear) threaded hole to get more leverage, you might end us sheepishly going to a local brake shop to have them get the old ones off/put these on.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my Lexus RX 400h
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a quality brake rotor and fit perfect on my 2006 Lexus RX 400h. They are also coated and you can tell as soon as you use them, you can see the difference between the pad contact area and the rest of the rotor. So (hopefully) it will show signs of rust a lot slower. They have been working great and look great too! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Tanzillo

customer_reviews.title: 16010148 inch and a half wheel studs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product. I would have given it 5 stars but do not rely on you garage tool for fitment. I am only giving it three stars because the quality of the description is in accurate you should definitely go to Bosch website and check fitment before ordering. I trusted Amazon website using my garage tool to check The fitment and It was wrong. If you have a 1999 or newer jeep Cherokee with one and a half inch wheel studs you need part number 16010148.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph w. Hogrefe

customer_reviews.title: Best Rotor!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of problems with rotors in the past but never with Bosch. Every Bosch QuietCast rotor I have gotten has never had the wobble of most others once put on. They also don't rust like most others because of the coating. Which in Maine is a problem. They are a great $$$ value both in cost and life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very good rotors and pads from Bosch. Minimal dust. I put these on the Ridgeline two years ago and they are excellent. Superior braking action. The inferior pads and brakes that were previously installed were not adequate nor safe. I put them on my Accura RDX and they are true and vibration free unlike the replacement brakes that were previously installed. Quality product from Bosch. It is hard to find Bosch brakes for my three BMW cars so I use OEM there.....
customer_reviews.author: B J.

customer_reviews.title: These Rotors are Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Bosch Quietcast rotors for vehicles in the past and they've always been really good quality. The coating Bosch applies holds up and even after several years of use, the rotors don't rust. Now keep in mind that I live in Colorado where cars don't rust too badly. I can't say how the coating would hold up in the NE part of the country. I bought this set for my 1999 Dodge Dakota. As usual, the quality is high and the rotor fit perfectly. Spend a few extra $$ and get these. They are worth it for the anti-rust coating alone. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Broomfield

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these Bosch disc brake rotors. It has been about 12,000 miles since I installed these premium rotors on my Honda Accord, and they still work like they did when I first installed them. Super quiet; smooth stopping power. Not like the cheap Chinese rotors that warp every time you hit a puddle. They are definitely heavily used with the driving I do going back and forth to work every day. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Mismatch
customer_reviews.text: These roters don't fit on my Honda Civic 2009. They are too large. The Amazon check said they were a match BUT they are not.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bozin

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR THE REAR!! THESE ARE FOR THE FRONT!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!! Bought these in February 2018 for my 2009 Mercedes-Benz C300 4matic Sport. Finally got time in May 2018 to install when I realized these do not fit in the rear as it is listed. My return time has already expired and now I am stuck with these as I already have front rotors from another seller (He got 5 Stars). I wish the seller would remove the listing as rear as these rotors are for the front.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelle Bournes

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you can feel the difference in quality!
customer_reviews.text: Went with Bosch Quiet Cast and pads for all four wheels on 2008 Nissan Rogue, and I am very happy with the performance so far. No, actually, I am ecstatic! I was so worried I wouldn’t notice enough of a difference to recommend the brand or justify the extra effort. We are two weeks installed and everything is matching, if no exceeding expectations with respect stability and confidence. That I paid of 3rd of the dealer cost to replace and install routers and pads on all four wheels is secondary. It’s the performance that impresses and confidence they build that validates the choice and effort. I hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: John E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good value, not covered in oil, good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect on 2009 Honda GX (made in Indiana, if it matters). Exact size as my old ones...note, I confirmed the size by looking up on the Bosch website. I guess some folks may have issues because Amazon says it fits...but the fronts and backs may be different sizes. Amazon could go next level and tell you if it fits the front or the back. Anyway, came painted and not covered in grease. Got 1,000 miles on them and so far so good. Running with new Akebono pads. Quiet, like new performance...glad I did it myself (knock wood).
customer_reviews.author: GA girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2011 Honda Pilot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for 2011 Honda Pilot - easy install if you have minimal brake work experience. As Honda rotors have a tendency to warp and give some wobble /shimmy when braking, these corrected that issue and for a much better price than OEM rotors or going to the dealer to machine old rotors. It is a good idea to pick up a JIS impact screwdriver for removal of existing rotor screws as the rotor screws are not Phillips, and a Phillips screwdriver will likely strip them out. Good luck with your project and Happy braking
customer_reviews.author: Stuart O.

customer_reviews.title: Great rotors and pads by Bosch
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my front brakes with these rotors and Bosch Quiet Cast pads and have zero issues. The brakes are quiet and work as expected. Pricey compared to others online but they come from a respected name and that is important in this day and age of almost anyone being able to get away with selling garbage on Amazon. Pros: Perfect fit No need to blast them with brake cleaner because they are coated Quiet Cons: A little pricey
customer_reviews.author: Gearz

customer_reviews.title: A quality rotor at less cost
customer_reviews.text: The rotors themselves went on fine, it was getting the old ones out that was a pain. There are 2 screws that hold in the old rotors, which this has a place for, but getting them out is almost impossible. In the end, we wound up drilling out the old screws, which means putting these on without the screws. I'm not a mechanic so don't take my word for it, but I didn't replace the screws and they have remained quiet and working, giving me more response at the brake and better confidence on the road. I'd recommend these highly for the money. Just remember to order 2, as they come as a single rotor.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on 2012 Honda CR-V AWD
customer_reviews.text: Going to start by saying these are a great purchase. Absolutely no regrets. Little more info below: I changed the original rotors out after 55k miles on the car and found a good reason to make sure the rotors are painted. The inner lip that holds the rotor had rust so that caused quite a bit of pain trying to free the rotor and it also caught the wheel. That said make sure to use a little bit of anti seize on the two screws that hold the rotor on, or you will need an impact screwdriver to break it. Pros: Painted Much quieter than OEM Very smooth braking
customer_reviews.author: Otis

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it fits with your vehicle before buying
customer_reviews.text: I bought these rotors for my Honda Civic 2011 Ex coupe and the amazon tool said it was compatible. I checked on Bosch website and it said it was compatible with my car. When I took it to my local mechanic for install I learned it doesn't fit as is and requires some adjustment before it can fit which added to the total install cost. Would be nice to know beforehand if the part is fully compatible or will need adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ant-rust Coating
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. They have an anti-rust coating so the part of the disc not rubbed by the brake pads stays rust-free. For Honda applications, there is no need to replace the two small screws holding it to the axle. They are made in China. They are sold individually, not in pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Patrick Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Buy these rotors - flawless performance
customer_reviews.text: I put these rotors on my 2002 Honda Civic EX one year and 15,000 miles ago and they have performed flawlessly. They were put on at the same time as Akebono ACT465A front brake pads. There is no shake or fade when stopping and the brakes provide great stopping power. I recommend these rotors (and the Akebono brake pads) completely.
customer_reviews.author: VW Guy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my 2006 Altima 3.5
customer_reviews.text: Low rating not based on product, but Amazon listed as compatible with my 2006 Nissan Altima. Brought to mechanic to install and found the rotors (front) where larger than the factory rotors so would not fit. Had to order a different set of Bosch rotors which worked fine from 2014 until 2019. Have a shimmy at high speeds now. Could get them turned, but would be cheaper just to install new ones
customer_reviews.author: legalmiles

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap Rotors, stay away, wrapped very bad in less then 4000 miles
customer_reviews.text: I bought theses since many websites recommend them but they wrapped in less than 4000 miles, it's terrible and dangerous, worst warping I've felt, I saw many reviews that warned against this cause it's seems some rotors are made in China and others somewhere else I believe, but anyways you have no control where you get them from and they don't back up their products at all so you are screwed with worthless rotors, STAY AWAY!!
customer_reviews.author: Abelflx

customer_reviews.title: These rotors are zinc plated!
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly as you would expect. I didn't expect them to be coated with something that would keep them good looking long after the install. I started to remove the coating with brake cleaner, but quickly realized it wasn't oil. The brake pads removed the coating down to the steel rotor surface in a few miles, but the coating protects the rest of the rotor. This is nice for anyone who wants their BMW's wheels and brakes to look good. The rotors work well, as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: PeeVee

customer_reviews.title: Avoid bosch automotive products at all costs
customer_reviews.text: These are just as bad as bosch’s brake pads. They warped in less than six months of normal usage. To make matters worse, bosch doesn’t stand behind their products; the only way for me to replace them is to buy new ones out of my pocket. I do not recommend bosch automotive products!
customer_reviews.author: John Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Problems with rotors, Problems with warranty.
customer_reviews.text: These rotors have a lifetime warranty. After 13,000 miles, my rotors began to "pulsate" during braking. I contacted Bosch and they connected me to their warranty department. I reached a recording that asked for a call back number. I left a message a few days ago and have not received a call back yet. I called Bosch a few more times and they offered no assistance other than to transfer me to the same warranty department. If you don't leave a call back number, after a few seconds the system hangs up on you. I guess I will have to buy something else. It won't be these.
customer_reviews.author: Betty L.

customer_reviews.title: First thing I noticed rotor has a coating all over ...
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed rotor has a coating all over (anti rust silver coating). Paired with Bosh BC943 QuietCast pads. Absolutely no noise when stopping and quite responsive. BTW the coating only burns off where the break pad touch the rotor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Moga

customer_reviews.title: quality machine work
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine workmanship for china. Put them on drove around and they do not grab as well as I expected. Matched with Bosch brake pads and not impressed so far, truly they feel spongy. I expected more out of a German company. BTW I bled the entire system with a pressurized setup. Lets see how they last, I will update in a few years if they last. Update: Grip increased however still not to my expectations. Lets see what they look like after one season of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: No shakes so far!
customer_reviews.text: I typically install Centric Premium rotors, but Amazon was sold out so I bought these. After a few hundred miles, still no shakes on the highwayor anything else unusual that would suggest an issue with machining or balance of these rotors. While I really enjoyed not having to clean off the "grease" before installing, I'm not sure how well the anti-corrosion coating will hold up in the north east. The black epoxy coated rotors usually stay rust free for 6+ months. Will update in time, installed with 114k.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Volvo XC90 with 336mm front rotors are better than factory Volvo
customer_reviews.text: Great brake rotors! I purchased these for my Volvo XC90 3.2 with 7-seater, but know they can fit the V8s as well as many 2.5t/3.2 with a 7-seater option. Double-check yours. These performed better than the original Volvo and stay rust-free longer than original Volvo since the Bosch is coated. I often brake hard from the upper highway speed limit and with a heavy XC90, these Bosch rotors don't warp.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki

customer_reviews.title: Smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Love that fit perfectly for my Mazda 3 I sport front wheels (passenger and driver side). It was easy to install and heavier than I thought lol. It’s fine I love it and it will be lasting for years to come. Drove the car and it was smoother than before. The ONLY caution is it’s only ONE rotor in the box. For some reason, I thought it was two so I had to reorder another one to fix both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Doll

customer_reviews.title: Nice surface finish
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Bosch’s Quietcast rotors in the past and have been really impressed with how well the coating holds up, even against winter road salt. I bought this set to use on my 2009 Legacy (non turbo). Fit perfectly and looks great. Good braking performance when paired with Quietcast pads.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Broomfield

customer_reviews.title: A quality set of Rotors.
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied. Nicely cast and machined. Will hopefully hold up better than the factory Volvo units they replaced. So far, 2,000 miles with a set of Bosch "QuietCast" ceramic pads and I am pleased. I am a moderate driver who occasionally "pushes it" and these are performing well. ( FYI: My Volvo S60 is a T5, but a "Sport" edition. Thus, my car uses 316mm rotors versus the standard 300mm, or the 336mm found on the R-Series cars. I recommend you double check your size as the dealer service dept. initially advised the incorrect diameter).
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe 12

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for 2010 Focus
customer_reviews.text: The car has a vibration in the front due to some frame damage, but it has been reduced with the lighter rotors. Less unsprung weight from the suspension. I honestly didn't even consider it until I held the two rotors (old v new) and then drove the car. The rotors themselves (paired with new pads) just feel so much better. Very predictable and firm. Definitely would use them again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good fit but missing the set screw
customer_reviews.text: timely delivery from amazon. These discs fit the BMW 2000 528iT just as promised, only about 200 miles so far but everything is good. Made in Czech republic with all the right markings etched on the edge. I am deducting one star because this is the first time I did not find the set screw included in the box with the brake disc. It caught me of guard and I had to reuse the rusty old screws
customer_reviews.author: Vasile Nistor

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 2016 Acura ILX, front rotors and they fit perfectly. I checked the Bosch site for the correct size but it did not have a front size for my car listed. I checked because Amazon has the number listed for 2013-2015 Acura RDX and not for ILX. I then checked 2 other sites which did had the Bosch front rotors and provided the number Bosch 26011548 QuietCast Premium. The other sites were priced around the same, however, I either had to pay for shipping to me or for return shipping if I decided to return the rotors. So, I decided to go with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Works for 5lug 2.4 2wd 98 tacoma.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 5lug 2.4 tacoma. Got these to replace my duralast rotors that didnt properly fit correctly - DO NOT GET THE DURALAST (aka DuraGo) ROTORS if you have the same tacoma make as mine (they dont screw in right) . These bosch rotors fit better and arent as insta-rust prone. Initial break-in for these takes a good while though so it may take a few careful drives until you can properly break at its fullest.
customer_reviews.author: Pervy

customer_reviews.title: Work great, fit great.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, I love these so far! My BMW 325i had an annoying intermittent problem when stopping; it would sometimes feel as if the brakes would grab and release, sort of like a thumping feel to it. The rotors on my car were not too old but I decided I would replace the front pads and rotors as a maintenance chore. It's easy enough to replace the rotors, by the way- not a hard task, just a careful one. The end result is a steady, smooth brake feel and sound now. No grab/release/grab feel at all, just a nice smooth bite and stop. These fit perfectly, are a well-made brand name. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Rust! Grrrr
customer_reviews.text: Have had these on for 6wks now and they work really well at doing what they're supposed to do...stop the car. They looked great out of the box, installed easy (mini R52), but....in less than 2wks the hubs and disc edges have completely rusted. So much for the advertising that the coating they use prevents rust. Looks like I have 50 yr old rotors now. Not pleased. What's odd is that the rear rotors I bought that are identical brand are great, no issues. I'll be contacting Bosch to figure this one out. If they hadn't rusted right away I'd give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: RenaissanceMan

customer_reviews.title: Great looking rotor, well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly sexy rotor; no joke. Yeah I know it's just a rotor but it's beyond a step above a typical brake rotor. I almost don't want to put these on my truck and instead hang it on the wall as art. That would be a challenge though, as this thing easily weighs 30 pounds. Absolutely worth the money. Unlike other rotors I've purchased in the past, this did not come caked in oil.
customer_reviews.author: G213

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Bosch, for high quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought full Bosch set of brake rotors and pads for my 2011 Infiniti g37x, installation was so easy, all part fits perfect! Rotors looks excellent with no rust or other corrosion after a few months. Brakes working really smooth! And a want to say, this Bosch brakes save my life, my wife’s life and big deer’s life who jumped in front of our car when we drive around 50 mile/hour....the car stopped in seconds, stopped with a squeal and smoke just a one second before the accident! Highly recommend Bosch brake for all of you because it’s safe.
customer_reviews.author: Igor S

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Worth the extra money versus low cost rotars that can warp
customer_reviews.text: I just performed another brake job on my second sedan. What i like about amazon is great prices on brake parts. The fronts cost more than the back pads/rotars....but having good breaks is like having a life boat during the sinking of the titanic... I prefer to have good stuff when i need it the most. Don't buy cheap break parts..... get good parts at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Godfather

customer_reviews.title: Purchase at own risk
customer_reviews.text: I went to a professional car mechanic to get it installed. When we were testing it, the ride was bumpy, noisy, and made more abrupt stops than usual. When I requested a refund it went through, HOWEVER the seller expected us to pay for shipping (Didn’t think it would be too much so I packed it up). The post office said that shipping would cost me a little over $100 and so I decided it wasn’t worth it. And now I’m stuck with two defective plates, again, buy at own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone ever buy those $40 store brand brake rotors from the chain stores??? These are 100x better. Great machining, no flat spots. Perfectly round. Great product and easy install for anyone that knows brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Sidewok

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good quality, but couldn't install it
customer_reviews.text: So, this brake rotor seemed to be of good quality. Proper size for the car and have always had good luck with Bosch products. Unfortunately, I couldn't confirm this since Amazon refused to ship the pair. Rotor 2 still shows as shipping soon, over a month later. I can't cancel it, customer service never followed up on my issue. Someday it will ship and I can promptly refuse delivery or return it. In the meanwhile, can't do a complete brake job with two new sets of pads and only one rotor, so I ended up returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nutting

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement discs
customer_reviews.text: My Ridgeline developed a shimmy when braking. I put these in and the braking is once again smooth and actually a little more responsive than before. They were easier to replace than the pads! I may check back when I have more long term experience with them, but the first impression is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rotors, not really much else to say
customer_reviews.text: Great rotors, not really much else to say. Better than stock, installed 6-700 miles ago with no noise braking or driving, no vibration. Replaced stock rotors on 2006 toyota corolla. If doing this yourself, no reason not to change rotors and pads at the same time as it takes about an extra 10 minutes to swap out rotors.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great Rotors
customer_reviews.text: Great rotors installed on my 09 Honda Fit. I took the extra step to paint all non brake touching areas with heat resistant paint that matched the aluminum finish. Should help with the rust build up. Make sure to cure paint in the oven before installing. I am a big believer in Bosch car parts.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Warped Out Of The Box
customer_reviews.text: I had a chirping sound after installing these Bosch rotors in the front. The chirping would go away when the brake pedal was pressed. The brake shop said they found that one of the rotors was so warped that it needed to be machined twice! These are NEW rotors that shouldn't need to be machined out of the box. Poor quality control from Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Fits RWD, not AWD/4x4
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a damaged package item from Amazon Warehouse for half price, but it would have been a good value at full retail. For some reason it's hard to find a RWD hub for the 04-08 F-150. This one works great, no problems with the ABS ring, installed in less than 30 minutes. Make sure to get a new spindle but and pin, and torque to 295ft/lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be a great quality disc.
customer_reviews.text: There's no left or right designation, only front, as the vanes are not directional. Mine came in bags, with a coating. Ready to install. Installation was easy, Caliper bracket for the QX60 was insanely tight, didn't notice any threadlocker from the factory, and torqued back to factory specs. Braking has been smooth, will report back if anything comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 front rotors, same part numbers, different in the boxes
customer_reviews.text: Like many other people here. I purchased 2 identical rotors, it came in with the identical boxes and part numbers. But were totally different rotors inside. They do looks and works ok, if you have both rotors. Now I have to return 1 rotor and hopefully the replacement is correct. Bosch has to work on their QC.
customer_reviews.author: Sorlo

customer_reviews.title: Great rotors!!
customer_reviews.text: These have totally changed how my truck stops - so smooth now! Was worth paying a little more but still very good price!!! Much better material then most: note the pictures - the silver non rusted is the new Bosch on the front. The other with rust type spots are duralast (went cheaper in the rear since they not as important but still regret it now!) I highly recommend these to everyone!!! Would buy again....and will!!’
customer_reviews.author: InfinitiDR

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: correct part for the 1998 saturn sl2 with 295,000 miles. the photo shows a disc with five studs this confused me a little since my saturn has four studs. I thought I had ordered the wrong part. I decided to open the package and bumbum !!! It is the correct part with four studs. very happy.
customer_reviews.author: MARCOS RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Bosch is a big name. This rotor is heavy. It felt solid and high quality. After installation, paired with Bosch quietcast pads. I honestly didn't feel any differences from the OEM rotor and pads installed at BMW dealership. This DIY saved me a lot of $$$. In the future, I am not letting dealership to do these easy maintenance work to scam my money anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit - 2004 Toyota Tacoma
customer_reviews.text: Found some conflicting information online about whether the 2004 Tacoma 4wd, 16" wheel takes 297 or 318mm rotors. Apparently, the larger rotors are only for the extremely rare stability control-equipped trucks. Others,like mine, use this common 297mm rotor. These rotors fit exactly like the ones that came off, simplifying my brake job and saving me two trips to the parts store to have the old ones resurfaced.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with the Bosch Quietcast pads on all four wheels of my 2009 Mazda6, and so far I couldn't be happier with them. When I bought the car used about two years ago it had some rotor warpage. I've gone through a couple different sets of pads and rotors, both ceramic and semi-metallic pads, never quite satisfied until I put these on. I installed these about a month ago and have put a couple thousand miles on them. They'be been dead quiet, not a single squeak, great feel and stopping power, no brake dust, and no sign of any rust yet. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Won't last much...
customer_reviews.text: I had it installed on my GLK 350 in February 2018 and now January 2019, they need to be replaced. I am a very cautious driver and I minimize the break use as my brake pads last about 8-10 years. I am not sure if it is the car or the rotors, but they are warped again. Or cracked. Also terrible customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honda Civic 2010 coupe
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on my car, was a little hard getting the original factory ones off, especially those 2 screws, but with patience and some penetrating lube it can be done! My car comes to a smooth stop now, before the steering wheel was shaking when I applied the brakes, not anymore, it's as smooth as butter!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: 15,000 mile...all good
customer_reviews.text: Had these on for about 15,000 miles.. All good. Car stops. Usually starts. What a wonderful world.
customer_reviews.author: Scott 1953

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance router with great price!!
customer_reviews.text: I install the on LEXUS RX 350 front with brake pad kit with Bosch after review several YouTube video I give a try instead OEM. I’ll tell you one thing SUPER quit rotor plus super clean surface since it won’t rust with open wheels view it look absolutely amazing plus performance. I can’t wait to change my another LEXUS LS 460 car would be the same brand for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Eli Mirza

customer_reviews.title: These plus Bosch Blue pads equal happy braking....
customer_reviews.text: Installed these on my Fathers Saturn along a set of Bosh Blue Pads. This combo has produced Excellent and dependable stopping power. Very smooth and quit and demonstrate little to no fade at any thing this side of legal. These have fixed the slight shudder that was present during high speed braking. I have a set of the Bosch blue pads on my car with 10k on them and if those are an indication of over all quality these will be the last discs my dad needs in his car.
customer_reviews.author: Ollbuster

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit 1997 Honda Civic CX
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin, well, just like most people that has posted, I didn't know this wasn't sold as a set so I had to end up purchasing another one 2 days later. Now to the product, it is too big to use with OEM calipers. Don't waste your money like I did. Since I'm doing a full rebuild from the ground up on my Honda Civic I didn't get to putting the front calipers/rotors on til after time was up to return for a full refund, and now I'm stuck with 2 rotors I'm not sure what car they fit to sell them
customer_reviews.author: Albion

customer_reviews.title: Great Rotors
customer_reviews.text: No cleaning required so quick to install. Did 3 easy, 3 medium and 3 hard stops from 50 mph with cool down period in between to wear in the pads. Brake pressure was almost the same from cold to hot after break in. Highly recommended. Used Bosch QuietCast Premium Semi-Metallic Disc pads.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: They had completely different coating and finish
customer_reviews.text: The rotors arrived on time, nice to be a Prime member. However they had completely different coating and finish. One was gray like the Bosch video and the second was bare metal. One was made in Italy and the other in the Czech Republic. I had no choice but to put them on and they seem to function the same. Just very disappointed and the main reason I go to the auto-parts store and look at everything they put on the counter to confirm the correct form/fit/function.
customer_reviews.author: Tomb

customer_reviews.title: These look great, and they arrive wrapped in plastic
customer_reviews.text: These look great, and they arrive wrapped in plastic, without preservative to remove. They installed without incident and, coupled with Bosch brake pads, are providing pulseless straight-ahead braking. I dropped a star because they lack the two small threaded holes in the center "Cap" that allow them to be removed if they become difficult to remove at the end of their life. The originals have those holes, and I had to use them to remove the driver's side original. So put a slight film of anti-seize on these where they will contact the axle. A few years from now, you will be happy you did so.
customer_reviews.author: John Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality rotors
customer_reviews.text: These rotors have been excellent for my wife's 2012 Highlander. My advice is to not go for something cheap or anything slotted/cross-drilled. I installed these with a new set of Bosch pads, and they have been silent and very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: ERIK BJELKE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2006 Accord
customer_reviews.text: Replaced front brakes on my 2006 Honda Accord and used these - perfect fit with no issues. My only advice would be to use care when removing the original mounting screws on the existing rotors as they can be rusted and are easy to strip out. I ended up using a hand impact driver (see TEKTON 2910 1/2-Inch Drive Manual Hand Impact Driver Set, 7-Piece also available on Amazon for $20) and I had no issues. There are plenty of good Youtube videos on replacing rotors, pads, etc. If you are not familiar with how to do it (like I was), then watch a few videos to see what to expect and things should go smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete S

customer_reviews.title: Not correct fitment too thin for mk3 VW
customer_reviews.text: These are solid rotors and they are not for your mk3 vw unless you have a Canadian model with an engine under 2.0L. This is not the correct rotor for any US market VW after 1992, it is 8mm too thin if your car came with vented rotors. Fitment chart is wrong/incomplete and this will not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: high quality rotors with an antirust coating/finish
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy big box auto parts rotors but these are cheaper and with higher quality to boot. Comes in a sealed bag with no oil, so minimal prep time with degreaser/brake cleaner was required. Using the Bosch QC pads, it stops my car quicker than the factory pads and rotors ever did.
customer_reviews.author: JLO FROM NC

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Bosch , made in china Q.C. so, so .
customer_reviews.text: After paying as much for EACH rotor, to get BOSCH quality, as an entire chinese brake kit, I was disappointed that the pilot bore on one rotor was WAY out of specification, poor sloppy fit on the spindle, giving vibration at all speeds. Otherwise, it's a great knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: The Guru in NH

customer_reviews.title: Good looking rotors
customer_reviews.text: Good looking rotors, look exactly as in the picture. Fit my 2006 Audi A6 Quattro. They come covered with some sticky coating, gotta use gloves and keep them clean when putting them on. Not sure if there was any performance improvement, but they make some noise when u let go of brakes and brake real fast again at really slow speeds. But it could be my new HPS Performance Ceramic Brake Pads wearing in. EDIT: After some time on my car, there is orange rust all over the rotor where the brake pads don't touch. Doesn't look good since these rotors are silver color. -1 star.
customer_reviews.author: YP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this seller
customer_reviews.text: My mechanic put the rotors on my car,they did not fit ,he took them off and put my old rotors on.Bosch is all I use for brakes,it is a quality product,this this the only problem I ever had with Bosch.It is not Bosch,it is with Amazon and this third party seller they deal with.Be careful.I will never order anything dealing with a car from Amazon again.Amazon told me send them back at my expense,which is bullcrap.an still no refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great rotors. Way better than OEM.
customer_reviews.text: Great rotors for 2005 Nissan Xterra. They look great and they won't rust. I previously purchased Nissan OEM rotors for $150 each and they started to rust within weeks even though they weren't exposed to salt. Save money and aggravation and get these instead.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So Far, All's Good
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my 2005 Honda Accord EX. Absolutely no issues with install. Old rotors were warped, so these were a really good replacement. It will be a while before I can say how well they perform, but after a few miles, they are working out quite well.
customer_reviews.author: James Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don`t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these rotors for my Q5 Audi along with TRW brakes both didn`t last for 8 months especially the rotors I received regular and none coated rotors, didn`t last for 5 months they become rusty and start to notice heavy vibration every time I hit the break. I won't even recommend anyone with a big or sporty truck to use these rotors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same as previous reviewer, but I have a 2005 ...
customer_reviews.text: Same as previous reviewer, but I have a 2005 545i, so I thought maybe they would work. Rotors seem to be well made, but these definitely do not fit e60 BMWs. The dimensions of the rotor are the same, but the offset (hat) is about 2mm different, so that the caliper bracket binds on the back surface of the rotor. Amazon, please update your parts compatibility list.
customer_reviews.author: TV Mann

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit - Amazon is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT fit 2013 Accord EX. These rotors are 11 inch in diameter, whereas the car requires 11.5 inches. I was able to realize this after already installing it. It looks like Amazon doesn't always have accurate fitment info. I know its a hassle but i recommend checking your rotor size before ordering on amazon. Otherwise you have to return it like i had to. I also bought rear rotors of this same kind and they were a perfect fit and seem of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Armagan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Slipped off the old and installed these new disks with no effort
customer_reviews.text: Bosch 50011225 QuietCast Premium Disc Brake for my 2010 Toyota Sienna fit great. The disks came coated in a protective paint so no oil to remove as some disks have. The disks matched the original perfectly. They have cut tolerances clearly stamped on the outer edge so you know what your options are during your next brake service. It has been a month now and there is no shaking or other indication of balance or vibration issues. I installed these with a set of new Bosch pads. My old disks came in handy too... I needed a new weighted base for a floor lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Always Tinkering

customer_reviews.title: great rotors
customer_reviews.text: These rotors worked very well on the 2014 Highlander and were perfect with no run-out. Brake pads seated properly and the vehicle stopped straight without any pulsation of vibration. All of this at a price much lower than you could get for the similar product at a local auto parts house.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: Yippee!!
customer_reviews.text: Ahhhhh. The pulsing of the warped rotors is gone The second try for the correct rotors paid off. Their should be a better way for mfrs/Amazon to correctly post which rotors are the correct ones for cars. I will update the positing at a later date Update 10/21/2017 time to replace rotors which have warped hence the downgrade to 3 stars. This gets very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DëV

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS FOR ONE ROTOR ONLY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought any brake rotors except by the pair. The fact that this listing is for one rotor only needs to be shown prominently at the top of the listing. I wound up ordering for the front and rear of my vehicle, and got 1 front rotor and 1 rear rotor, which was the wrong one. Will be returning all of them back to Amazon. Just my opinion, but very deceptive advertising!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Porter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I've used Bosch before and they seem to do well with their stuff. These were nice and thick, smooth, well packaged and fit on like a charm. Half the price of the local auto store. After the break-in of these with the Bosch pads the truck stops better than before.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Carson

customer_reviews.title: No oily packing grease.
customer_reviews.text: Appear well made and have a painted coating on the entire rotor to prevent rust between the factory and user. I prefer this method to the alternative, which is coating the rotor with a thick film of oil/grease. That stuff takes a whole $5 can of brake cleaner to get off, which is a must or the brake pads will become contaminated. Instead, this coating just takes a handful of hard stops to rub off. I had a pair of Centric rotors set aside to use on a different car, but same model. The Centric were a bit thicker and marginally cheaper, but were coated in the oil.
customer_reviews.author: maniac121

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Rotors - Warped after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this junk. I only drive my 2005 Altima 10000 miles in the city per year and bought these rotors in June 2017. There is now an awful vibration up front when braking at 65mph. Already checked with mechanic who confirmed what I already knew - - warped rotor. Skip this mess and get something of a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Breadwinner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rotors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these rotors because they are an exact fit for my car and from Robert Bosch Corp. The quality is excellent and I like that they are Dacromet coated for corrosion and brake squeal. I also install Bosch disc brake pads too. My brakes are like new!
customer_reviews.author: t594

customer_reviews.title: Be aware oh you're purchases
customer_reviews.text: The price being good is not the issue. these rotors are painted black and that black paint will come off every time you hit the brakes and go onto the pads ruining them. very very poor design. I spent a lot of time removing that cheap paint from the surface of the rotor so that I would not have a big problem later on. be careful what you buy .people will sell anything ...they don't care about your safety
customer_reviews.author: J. Wahl

customer_reviews.title: I've always trusted Bosch because of the better engineering than others
customer_reviews.text: To simply put, it works, the company claims that it has used the purest metal and that its better balanced than most disc brake. It has held up to its claim... my brakes do not shake, no warp, the coating is still clean (silver color), very smooth surface, no cracks yet : ) And I drive over 50 miles everyday on the freeway. Do not buy other brands that may have used / mixed cheaper metal quality to save weight or costs or you will get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Norin

customer_reviews.title: Works on my Sienna Minivan
customer_reviews.text: BIG heavy package for a Toyota Sienna Minivan! Plan accordingly - this took a couple of years off the life of my UPS guy. Also, it shipped very slowly, took a couple of weeks to get in. I am a Prime member, and am used to stuff coming in a couple of days. This was tortuously long. But it fit on the Minivan, and seems to solve a nasty shimmy problem I was having with the antilock brakes. These babies are definitely heavy duty, and I cant wait to see how they work in mountain roads - if you don't see an additional comment, assume that so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Spockwithalightsaber

customer_reviews.title: “These are the parts you are looking for”
customer_reviews.text: I installed new rotors and matching pads on my 2009 Mazda 6 GT a little over a year ago. These Bosch Quiet Cast brake parts perform like OEM and do not RUST... that’s right, they look great! The pads and rotors work well together and provide positive stopping power on demand. I will defenatly replace brakes in the future using theses parts.
customer_reviews.author: JeepRubicon2k3

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: The rear rotors warped after only a week. There was also rust present on the rotor cap already. I drove carefully during the break in period with no hard braking. It was the hassle of returning them or just getting them turned. I decided on turning them as it was the easiest option. And I need a car to get to work obviously. Disappointed in the quality. Would not buy Bosh rotors again.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepinginlight

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Rotors
customer_reviews.text: I needed rotors quick for a brake job and bought a pair from the neighborhood store of a big auto parts chain. Both rotors were warped right out of the box. I returned them and ordered a pair of the Bosch rotors. I have them on a Suburban, an Accord and now my daughter's Impala. Never had problems with them, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Bosch 50011343 QuietCast Premium Disc Brake Rotor For Scion: 2005-2010 tC; Toyota: 2000-2005 Celica, 2003-2008 Corolla, 2003-2008 Matrix; Front
product_meta.description:
Size:50011343| Color:FrontBosch QuietCast Premium Disc Brake Rotors utilize innovative materials that ensure the highest quality performance, prevent rust and corrosion with clear-look coating protection, provide a clean look for today's open-wheeled vehicles, are 100% precision balanced for smooth operation, and have a factory-engraved edge with code and minimum thickness specifications. 

 Professional installers recognize Bosch as OEM and can be assured Bosch QuietCast­ Premium Brake Rotors provide the highest quality to the aftermarket, from the company with over 70 years of OE braking expertise.

AMAZON.COM


BOSCH BRAKE ROTORS
 Today, one of every three Asian, Domestic, and European vehicles on the road in North America include Bosch braking components. That is because Bosch has been a key player in the braking industry since its first brake system design patent in 1936. Bosch introduced Antilock Braking technology to the market, as well as Electronic Stability Control systems. Now Bosch brings years of Original Equipment braking experience to the aftermarket with Bosch QuietCast Premium Disc Brake Rotors.

Bosch QuietCast Premium Disc Brake Rotors is a name you can depend on. Minimum tolerance levels and innovative materials ensure the very highest quality and prevent brake judder, noise, vibration, and harshness. Rely on the experience that Bosch brings with over 70 years of Original Equipment brake manufacturing.

QUIETCAST – THE SCIENCE BEHIND THE SILENCE
 Bosch QuietCast Brake Rotors utilize vehicle specific castings. The heat flow casting process produces superior G3000, GG20, GG15, and HC (high carbon) casting. Bosch casting provide strength and durability not found in competitive products. While competitors may provide a low cost product, their casting may crack and may have poor durability. Bosch QuietCast is designed to provide consistent, safe, and long lasting performance.

BOSCH QUIETCAST FEATURES
 *  Homogeneous heat flow 
 *  Superior heat dissipation 
 *  Safe, consistent performance 
 *  Superior noise dampening characteristics 
 *  Designed for long life 
 *  Precision balanced: Insures smooth operations
 *  Industry low run-out and DTV specifications: Smooth pedal feel with no pulsation 
 *  Heat flowing castings: Consistent wear for long life and quiet operation 
 *  Original Equipment manufacturing style vane configuration: Heat reduction extends rotor life 
 *  Factory engraved edge code: Allows proper identification and discard specification 
 *  Premium clean look coating protection: Prevent rust and corrosion, part number specific 
 *  ABS sensor rings included (on required applications): Trouble free ABS/TCS operation
feature_bullets: Precision balanced to insure smooth operation with no pedal pulsation
OEM style vane configuration provides more efficient heat dissipation, reduces vibration that can cause noise, and extends rotor life
G3000 heat-flowed castings provide consistent wear, long life, and quiet operation
Bi-metal aluminum and zinc clean-look coating/Alutherm 80 extends the life of the rotor and provides a clean look for today's open wheels
OEM style ABS tone ring (on required applications) provides trouble free operation of Antilock Brake and Traction Control systems
Front: Scion: 2005-2010 tC; Toyota: 2000-2005 Celica, 2003-2008 Corolla, 2003-2008 Matrix

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,449 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
